thread.title: President Trump calls 'negative polls' fake news in Twitter rage
thread.title_full: President Trump calls 'negative polls' fake news in Twitter rage

author: ADAM EDELMAN
title: President Trump calls 'negative polls' fake news in Twitter rage
text:
President Trump calls 'negative polls' fake news on Twitter President Trump calls 'negative polls' fake news on Twitter Trump's latest social media screeds also come amid controversy surrounding his executive order on immigration. (NICHOLAS KAMM/AFP/Getty Images) NEW  48 AM 
President Trump on Monday morning blasted any "negative polls" about his favorability as "fake news" and insisted that he was in charge — a possible response to mounting coverage suggesting his chief strategist has really been calling the shots. 
"I call my own shots, largely based on an accumulation of data, and everyone knows it. Some FAKE NEWS media, in order to marginalize, lies!" Trump tweeted Monday morning. I call my own shots, largely based on an accumulation of data, and everyone knows it. Some FAKE NEWS media, in order to marginalize, lies! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 6, 2017 
"Any negative polls are fake news, just like the CNN, ABC, NBC polls in the election," Trump added. "Sorry, people want border security and extreme vetting." 
Trump's tweet may reference a Time magazine cover story, titled "Is Steve Bannon the Second Most Powerful Man in the World," that theorizes that Trump's White House Chief Strategist has outsized influence over his boss.
